seniority_level.evidence: Title is 'Data Engineer' and requires 5-8+ years of experience in Data Management and Data Engineering.

job_family.evidence: Title explicitly mentions 'Data Engineer-Data Platforms' and responsibilities focus on building data platforms using AWS and Hadoop.

sub_specialty.evidence: Mentions both streaming (Kafka) and batch (Spark, Hive) processing paradigms, along with data warehouse (AWS RedShift) and data lake (Hadoop/S3) technologies.

leadership_expectation.evidence: Role involves developing pipelines for multiple use cases and scalable solutions, suggesting technical leadership without explicit people management.

primary_cloud.evidence: AWS Cloud Data Platform and AWS services (EMR, Glue, RedShift) mentioned explicitly multiple times.

secondary_clouds.evidence: No other cloud providers mentioned beyond AWS.

processing_paradigm.evidence: Both streaming (Kafka) and batch (Spark, Hive) processing are mentioned as responsibilities.

orchestrator_category.evidence: No explicit mention of orchestration tools like Airflow, Luigi, or cloud-native orchestrators.

storage_layer.evidence: Mentions AWS RedShift (warehouse) and Hadoop/S3 (lake) as part of the data platform responsibilities.

remote_restriction.evidence: Location is specified as 'Pune, Maharashtra, India', implying a regional or city-based restriction.

timezone_focus.evidence: No timezone requirements or team distribution details mentioned.

relocation_required.evidence: No mention of relocation packages or requirements; location is specified as Pune, implying residency is already expected.

h1b_friendly.evidence: No explicit mention of visa sponsorship in Pass 1 results.

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No signals related to OPT/CPT or student visa eligibility.

citizenship_required.evidence: No discussion of work authorization or citizenship requirements in the job posting or Pass 1 results.

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Employment type stated as 'full_time' in Pass 1 results, and benefits are typically associated with W2 employees.

benefits_level.evidence: No benefits discussed in the job posting or Pass 1 results.

growth_path_clarity.evidence: No explicit or implied career growth paths discussed in the job posting.

mentorship_signals.evidence: Mentions delivering deep technical and industry expertise, which may involve mentorship from senior team members.

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No mention of promotion or advancement paths in the job posting.

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No mention of internal mobility or role changes in the job posting.

career_tracks_available.evidence: No explicit or inferred career tracks mentioned in the job posting.

requirement_strictness.evidence: Pass 1 results show all skills listed as 'must_have_hard_skills' with no 'nice_to_have' skills, and strict experience requirements (5-8+ years).

scope_definition.evidence: Job description focuses on a single role with well-defined responsibilities in data engineering and platform development.

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Skill requirements align reasonably with 5-8+ years of experience for a senior data engineer role.
